results.p: On the other hand, DWORD specifies its own size, which is Double Word. Words are 16 bits, so DWORD will be known as 32 bits across all platforms ...
Aug 2, 2021 — Allocates and optionally initializes a double word (4 bytes) of storage for each initializer. DWORD is a synonym of DD. Syntax.
Feb 29, 2016 — DWORD is a typedef for, as you mentioned, 'double word' sized integers. It's a way of sizing them, rather than giving bit numbers.
DWORD is a 32-bit value (it's short for “double-word” and a “word” is 16 bits) and QWORD is a 64-bit value (short for “quad-word”).
